meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The rucs of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The lion let out a powerful rucs in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The baby's rucs could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent4: The rucs of the old car engine echoed in the garage.
meanings.sent5: The piercing rucs of the fire alarm woke everyone up.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The owl rucs loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: The child rucsed for attention in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat rucsed when it got stuck in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The wind rucsed through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The singer rucsed with all her might during the performance.

meanings.sent1: The rusty gate made a loud rucs when opened.
meanings.sent2: The chalkboard made a terrible rucs when the teacher wrote on it.
meanings.sent3: The old radio emitted a strange rucs before playing music.
meanings.sent4: The car brakes screeched with a sharp rucs.
meanings.sent5: The metal spoon clanged against the pot with a metallic rucs.

meanings.definition: To utter a harsh, grating noise.
meanings.sent1: The old door rucsed as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The rusty hinges rucsed when the window was opened.
meanings.sent3: The gears rucsed as the machine started up.
meanings.sent4: The chains rucsed as the gate swung open.
meanings.sent5: The old floorboards rucsed under the weight of each step.
